What is the purpose of the `getcurrencytrust` command in Verus?
The `getcurrencytrust` command is used to retrieve rating values for specified currencies or all currencies if no specific currencies are specified.

getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]' Arguments "["currencyid",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified currencies, otherwise all Result: {  "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object  "currencytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Examples: > verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getcurrencytrust
How do I use the `getcurrencytrust` command to retrieve rating values for specific currencies?

You can use the `getcurrencytrust` command by specifying the IDs of the currencies you want to retrieve rating values for, separated by commas, within an array. For example:

```
verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid1", "currencyid2",...]'
```

getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]' Arguments "["currencyid",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified currencies, otherwise all Result: {  "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object  "currencytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Examples: > verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getcurrencytrust
What is the format of the result returned by the `getcurrencytrust` command?

The result returned by the `getcurrencytrust` command is a JSON object with two properties: `setratings` and `currencytrustmode`. `setratings` is an object with IDs as keys and rating values as values, while `currencytrustmode` is an integer indicating the trust mode (0 for no restriction, 1 for syncing only to approved IDs, and 2 for syncing to all IDs except those on the block list).

getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]' Arguments "["currencyid",...]"                    (strarray, optional) if specified, only returns rating values for specified currencies, otherwise all Result: {  "setratings":{"id":JSONRatingObject,...},    (jsonobj) an ID/ratings key/value object  "currencytrustmode":<n>              (int) 0 = no restriction on sync, 1 = only sync to IDs rated approved, 2 = sync to all IDs but those on block list } Examples: > verus getcurrencytrust '["currencyid",...]' > curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
./raw_text_input_api_text/getcurrencytrust
How can I use the `getcurrencytrust` command via the Verus RPC interface?

You can use the `getcurrencytrust` command via the Verus RPC interface by sending a POST request to `http://127.0.0.1:27486/` with a JSON payload containing the method, parameters, and other required information. For example:

```
curl --user myusername --data-binary '{"jsonrpc": "1.0", "id":"curltest", "method": "getcurrencytrust", "params": ['["currencyid",...]'] }' -H 'content-type: text/plain;' http://127.0.0.1:27486/
```
